document_data.name: Varnish
document_data.mainbody: '''Varnish''', or '''lacquer''', was a manufactured substance used for sealing and finishing other materials, similar to [[wax]], [[enamel]], [[pitch]], and [[paint]].
document_data.Crafting: Varnish could be made from [[resin]]s such as [[propolis]], [[lakh resin]], and [[lacquer tree]] resin, often thinned with [[terebinth]].
document_data.Usage: Varnishes and lacquers were widely used as sealants for [[wood]] and other substances, especially as protection against wet and humid conditions such as in [[Chult]]. The wooden components of [[weapon]]s and [[armor]] were usually varnished, as well as furniture and common [[tool]]s. [[Metal]] could also be varnished to give it protection or decoration, as could [[leather]], [[cloth]], and [[ceramic]]s.
